thread.title: Van Gisbergen snares Gold Coast V8s pole
thread.title_full: Van Gisbergen snares Gold Coast V8s pole

author: AAP
title: Van Gisbergen snares Gold Coast V8s pole
text:
Van Gisbergen snares Gold Coast V8s pole Posted by AAP + on 24/10/2015 at 1:24 pm AFL GRAND FINAL OFFER! If your team leads at any break but loses, CASH BACK up to $100!* PLUS Sign up now for a $501 Bonus Bet! Van Gisbergen snares Gold Coast V8s pole 
Holden’s Shane Van Gisbergen has snared pole position from fellow New Zealander Scott McLaughlin for Saturday’s V8 Supercars race on the Gold Coast. 
The Tekno Autosports driver posted a fastest lap of one minute and 11.5442 seconds on the 2.98km Surfers Paradise street circuit in the top-10 shootout for pole. 
A previous winner on the Gold Coast, Van Gisbergen’s pole is his first P1 for the season. 
He finished ahead of fellow New Zealander Scott McLaughlin. 
The Volvo driver will start from second after posting a 1:11.6854, narrowly missing out on pole position to Van Gisbergen. 
Championship leader Mark Winterbottom qualified third for the 300km race, alongside Nissan’s Rick Kelly. 
Winterbottom’s main championship rival, Bathurst champion Craig Lowndes, will start from sixth position. 
Lowndes’s teammate, defending series champion Jamie Whincup, had been hoping to put his Bathurst nightmare behind him where he was penalised late in the 1000km endurance classic for passing the safety car. 
Whincup had qualified second-fastest for the shootout but a ragged lap means he’ll have to start the race from seventh position. 
Saturday’s race begins at 2.35pm AEST.
